Question: What has been the most formative experience in your life that has defined the achiever/leader you are today?

Question: Tell me about a time when you weren’t satisfied with the quality your work.  How did you handle it?

What to look / probing questions:
What need did the process address? Did it require adaptation, how did you know? What was the result and benefit? Anything you'd do differently next time? 
 => Vision, Senses Big Opportunity, Problem Solving

Question: Tell me about a time you got enjoyment out of working hard on something.
Give me an example of a time you had to work on a project/task that you were absolutely deading.
Give me an example of something you've done in previous jobs that demonstrates your willingness to work hard.
Describe a challenging project that you worked on.
Give me an example of a time that you had to act with very little planning.
Tell me about a time that you willingly took on more work even though you were already busy. How were you able to get everything done ?
We all feel that we are unique in our accomplishments. Tell me an an accomplishment you have had that you feel is unique.

Sometimes people will drag their feet in taking action on something, losing precious time. Tell me about a time you saw that other people in the organization were not acting quickly on something and took it upon yourself to lead the effort.

Question: What types of bosses have been the most difficult for you? How did you manage the situation?
Have you ever had to meet deadlines while being constantly interrupted? How did you cope?
Tell me about a situation in which you had to adjust quickly to changes in the organization or your department? What did you do?
How have you handled a new boss who changed your job description?
Describe a time when you embraced a change being made, when you didn’t agree with the change.
Tell me about the most difficult change you’ve had to implement in your career.
What have you done when you’ve been given a project beneath your level of responsibility or experience?
How have you handled a new employee who knew less than you, but was now your boss?
Tell me about a time you had to work with conflicting, delayed, or ambiguous information. What did you do to make the most of the situation ?
Tell me about a time when ambiguity was an obstacle to you getting a task or project completed. What was ambiguous? How long was it ambiguous?
Give me an example of a time when there was a decision to be made and procedures were not in place. What was the outcome?

We have all been asked on occasion to perform a task or accomplish a goal where the instructions we received were ambiguous. Tell me about a time when this happened to you and specifically what you did.
Give an example of a time when you could not participate in a discussion or could not finish a task because you did not have enough information.
Tell me about a time when you had to complete a project/task on a strict deadline with little or no direction.
Tell me about the most complex or difficult information you have had to analyze.
Tell me about the task or project that you were responsible for that best demonstrates your ability to analyze information.
Sometimes even though we study the data from all sides, we make errors in interpretation of the data. Tell me about a time that happened to you.
Give me an example of a time where you caught a discrepancy or inconsistency in the available information that might have caused significant problems if you had missed it.
Describe a time where your "logical analysis" was seen as illogical or flawed by someone else.

There are times where there is an incredible amount of data and information to be analyzed. Tell me about a time you faced this situation and exactly what you did to boil everything down to what was most important.
Tell me about a time when someone came to with a problem. What did you do?
Give me an example of a difficult problem someone recently needed your help to solve.
Give me an example of a time an employee came to you and was anxious about something. How did you handle the situation? What was the result?
Describe a time when you went out of your way to put someone at ease.
Tell me about a time you were able to establish a rapport with a person that others reffered to as "difficult".
Give me an example of a time that you were provided with information that enabled you to stop a potential problem from occuring.
Give me some examples of when someone remembered you after only a brief introduction. Why do you think they remembered you?
Give me some examples of how people in other parts of the organization use your department or group as a resource.
Give me an example of a decision that was made in your area that had an adverse impact on another area or department.
Tell me about about a decision you made that had an unexpected positive impact on another area or department.
Give me an example of a time where your understanding of your organization enabled you to get something you needed that, had you lacked the understanding, you probably would not have gotten.
Tell me about a time you recognized a problem before your boss or others in the organization did. What was the problem? What was the result?
Describe a time when politics at work affected your job. How did you deal with it?
Tell me how you went about learning how your current organization works.
Tell me about your career plan and what you have done so far to accomplish it.
Describe for me how you have "made your own luck".
Give me an example of how you have taken control of your career.
Give me an example of a time you knew you had outgrown a position and it was a time to move on.
Tell me about your greatest career achievements. Why did you pick those examples?
Tell me about a time you felt "off track" in your career progress.
Tell me about a time when you turned down a good job.
Give me an example of how you have celebrated an individual's or your teams success in the past. What was the occasion?
Tell me about a time when you were able to provide a direct report with recognition for the work she performed. What did you do?
Tell me about a time you missed an opportunity to provide a direct report with recognition for a significant accomplishment. Why did you miss it? What did you do when you realized you missed it?
Tell me what you have done on a consistent basis to ensure that your direct reports feel valued for their contributions?
Describe a time when one of your direct reports was under a great deal of pressure or stress. What did you do in the situation? What was the outcome?
Tell me about a time that you sensed that something was wrong with one of your direct reports and talked to him about it. What was the result?
Give me an example of a time that you realized that one of your direct reports was overburdened with work. What did you do? How did your action affect the situation?
Describe a work situation that required you to really listen and display compassion to a coworker/employee who was telling you about a personal/sensitive situation.
Tell me about the most difficult change you’ve had to implement in your career. How did you manage the change?
Give me an example of a time when you missed the early signs of employee resistance to an organizational change.
Describe a time when you felt that a planned change was inappropriate. What did you do? What were the results?
Tell me about a time when you had to adapt to an uncomfortable situation.
Tell me about a time you led a change effort.
Describe a time a change effort you were involved in was not as successfull as you or the company would have liked.
Give me an example of a time you had to adjust quickly to changes over which you had no control. What was the impact of the change on you?

Give me an example of a time when you helped a direct report or other person in the organization accept change and make the necessary adjustments to move forward. What were the change/transition skills that you used?
Describe a situation where you, at first, resisted a change at work and later accepted it. What, specifically, changed your mind?

Describe a situation when you offered assistance to someone even though it was outside of your job description.
Describe a situation in which you helped a team member out.
Tell me about a time when you saw someone else needed help in a previous job. How did you help?
Describe a time you were able to provide a higher level management person with recognition for the work she performed.
Tell me about a presentation you made to upper management. What was it about? How did you feel about making the presentation? How did it go?
Give me an example of a time where, by speaking management's language, you were able to convince them to do something that they migh not have done otherwise.
Give me an example of a time where, despite being tense or nervous, you were able to make a successful presentation to a higher level management group.

Tell me about a time where, had you taken time to think about how a higher level management person or group liked to receive information, you might have been more successful. If you had it to do over again, what would you do differently?
Tell me about the most difficult or complex idea, situation, or process you have ever had to explain to someone. How did you explain it? Were you successful?
Give me an example of a time you had to be excellent at multidirectional communication in order to be successful at something.

Describe a time when you had difficulty communicating your thoughts clearly to another person or group. What message were you trying to convey? Where did the difficulty in communicating lie? How did you end up getting your point accross?
Describe a time you used verbal communication to get accross a point that was important to you. Were you successful? How do you know you were successful/unsuccessful?
Give me an example of a time when you were able to successfully communicate with another person even when that individual personnaly may not have liked you.

Describe a situation you observed or were a part of where communication was handled particularly well by someone else. What did they do? Why do you think it was effective?

Tell me about a time when someone misunderstood somthing you said. How did you determine that you had been misunderstood? How did you make yourself clear? What did you learn from this situation that you have used to improve your communication skills?
Describe a time you failed to communicate important information to your boss.

Tell me about a time you failed to communicate effectively with your direct reports/client/customer. How did you find out you had failed to communicate effectively? What was the implication of this failure? What did you do about the situation? What did you learn from this?
Tell me about a time when your dislike for an individual had a negative impact on your ability to communicate effectively with this person.
Tell me about a situation when you dealt with an angry customer successfully?  Not as successfully?
When recently did you have to build a relationship with a new customer? How did you break the ice? Develop deeper ties?
Tell me about a time when you had to deal with a challenging customer.

What was the situation and the environment for giving feedback?
 => Confidence, Effective Communication Skills

Did anything change in the relationship with that person ? 
How did you make sure that it would not happen again ?

Question: Describe a time when you resolved a conflict.

Why did you decide to speak up?

Tell me about a time you feel you mismanaged an emotionally charged situation.

Give me an example of a time where your understanding of your own emotions- and of the triggers that set off emotional responses in you- saved you from doing or saying something in a business setting that you might have regretted.
Describe for me a time you were able to transform your anxiety or negative emotions into positive emotions and actions.
Give me an example of a time where-even thought it was difficult- you were able to control and filter your emotions in a constructive way.

Describe for me a time when you provided your direct reports with the freedom to determine their work process, within the parameters of the task/project, even though you would have preferred that they do it another way.
Tell me about a time you encouraged a direct report to make decisions within is area of responsibility that worked out better than you expected.

Give me an example of the time you encouraged a direct report to make a decision within her area of responsibility that did not work out well. What happened? What did you do? What was the final end result?
Tell me about a time you encouraged your direct reports to be actively involved in solving problems related to their position rather than coming to you for the answers.
Give me a specific example of how you have empowered your staff to make independent decisions.
Describe a time when, even though it was difficult, you kept quiet and let a team resolve problems on its own rather than prescribing a solution for them.
Describe a time when you failed to treat all your direct reports equally.
Tell me about a time you had to have a candid discussion with one or your direct reports regarding a work-related issue.
Give me an example of a time you had to handle a tough employee problem that challenged your ability to remain fair to all employees.
Tell me about a time you gave one employee preferential treatment. Why did you do it? What was the impact?
Tell me about a time when you treated all your direct reports equally even though you were tempted to show preferential treatment to one or some of them.
Tell me about a time when you had to stop working on a project/idea/assignment and start working on a completely different one. What did you do? How did that work out?
Give me an example of a time your tightly scheduled day was interrupted and thrown way off schedule.
Describe a time when you changed your behavior to fit a specific situation.
What to look / probing questions: Make sure you you find out, at minimum, what the situation was, what the specific behavior was prior to and after the change, why the behavior change was made, and whether the behaviour change was appropriate in retrospect.

Question: Tell me about a time when you changed or modified your priorities to meet another person's or group's expectations.
Tell me about a time when you had to change your point of view or your plans to take in account new information or a change in priorities.
Describe a time when you were instructed to modify or change your actions to respond to the needs of another person. Do you feel that the demand was fair? Why or why not?
Tell me about a time you uncovered new information that affected a decision that you had already made.
Tell me about a situation in which you have had to adjust to changes over which you had no control.
Tell me about a time when you had to adjust to another person's working style in order to complete a project/task/goal.
Describe an instance when you had think on your feet to extricate yourself from a difficult situation.
Describe a time when you made a major sacrifice to achieve an important goal.
Give me an example of a time when you didn't bend on the policy, procedure, or operation, and later wished you had.
Give me an example of a time you were unwilling or unable to make the necessary sacrifice to achieve a goal.

Most organizations today make ongoing changes in policies and procedures. Tell me about a time you had difficulty in dealing with one of these changes. What about the change made it difficult? How did you deal with the situation?
Tell me about a situation in which you had to apply some newly acquired knowledge or skill. What was the knowledge or skill?
In your current (most recent) position, tell me how you developed an appropriate depth of knowledge and skill about the company's products/services.
Tell me about the changes or issues that are being discussed or taking place in your area of expertise. How are these issues or changes affecting the way you do your job?
Tell me how you keep abreast of the professional/technical aspects of your position.
Tell me about a time you anticipated the need to improve a technical functional skill and took action proactively.
Give me an example of a time you took the initiative to find out about the new or upcoming product/service change.
Give me an example of where your understanding of your job contributed to solving a larger problem in the organization.
Describe a situation where your professional/technical expertise made a significant difference.

Tell me about a time where your industry knowledge enabled you to identify a potential problem and develop a strategy to address it. What in your knowledge base enabled you to detect the potential problem?
Through a real-life story, convince me that you are able to apply specific product/service knowledge to solve an internal or external problem.
Give me an example of how you acquired a technical skill and converted it into a practical application.
Tell me about your greatest success in using logic to solve a (technical/functional/jobs kill) problem. Why do you think you were successful?
At some point, everyone gets in over his head. Tell me about a time this happened to you.
Tell me about a time you were unable to overcome a (technical/functional/job skill) problem? Why do you think you were unsuccessful? What did you learn from that situation?
Give me an example of an important goal you had to set and how you accomplished that goal.
Give me an example of a time when you set a goal and were able to meet or achieve it.
Tell me about a time when your department was going through long-term changes or working on a long-term project. What did you do to keep your staff focused?
Tell me about an important goal you failed to achieve.

Describe a time when you set a goal for yourself and did not achieve it because it was too high. What was the standard? Why was it too high? What were the ramifications of your failure to achieve the goal?
Describe a time when you set a goal for yourself that was too low.
Describe how you set your goals for last year and how you measured your work. Did you achieve your goals? If not, why not?
Tell me about a major project you recently finished. Specifically, how did you set the goals and monitor your progress?

Give me an example of a time when you used a systematic process to define your objectives even though you were not prompted or directed to do so. What type of system did you use? What payoff did you get from using the process?
Tell me about a time you were given a goal by someone else that you believed would be impossible to attain.
Give me an example of a time you made a major sacrifice to achieve an important goal.
Tell me about a time when you were unwilling or unable to make the sacrifice necessary to achieve a goal.
Describe your organization's culture and how that culture made it challenging for you to achieve one of your goals.
Give me an example of a time you were reponsible for hiring and orienting a new employee. What did you do to help him learn the new job? What did you do to help him learn about the company?
Tell me about the best hire you ever made.
Tell me about the worst hire you ever made.
Tell me about a time you discovered raw talent within your organization and recruited that person. How did it work out?
Give me an example of the talents and skills that a couple of your direct reports have that you don't possess.
Walk me through the process you used for the last position you filled.
Every now and then there is a position that is hard to fill. Tell me about the last time you had to deal with that. Why was the position hard to fill? How did you overcome that obstacle?
Tell me about a time you used your sens of humor to diffuse a potential problem.
Give me an example of a time that you did something so silly that you had to laugh at yourself.
Describe a situation where you used humor to ease tensions.
Give me an example of a time where, in retrospect, if you had used your sense of humor, something at work would most likely have worked out better.
Tell me about a time where you used humor that backfired on you.
Tell me about a situation where you dealt effectively with another's person's inappropriate use of humor.
Give me an example of a time when your ability to employ a sense of humor made you more successful than if you had not used it.
Tell me about a time when someone gave you critical or constructive feedback.
What to look / probing questions: Openess to receiving feedback.

Question: Describe a situation in which you wished you had acted differently with someone at work. What happened?

Tell me about your most recent failure (or most painful experience).
Have you ever been in a highly uncertain or ambiguous work situation? How did you react?

What were the key learnings? Gauge self awareness, ability to maintain perspective and impact on those around him/her.

Describe an example of your weakest skill area, and how you manage it.

Describe a time when you had to persuade someone to go along with your idea. How did you do it? With your Boss? Peer? Direct Report?
When have you inspired someone to work harder or better at a job?  How?
Describe a time when you had to influence someone to do something differently than they were used to. How did you do it?
Describe a specific situation where you had to influence a group to achieve a shared goal.
What to look / probing questions:
What was the situation & goal? What steps did you take?
 => Business Vision, Senses Big Opportunity, Inspires, Conveys Energy

Question: Tell me about the best idea you ever sold to a peer, employee, or higher level management. What was your approach? Why do you think you succeeded?
Tell me about a time when you anticipated a problem and were able to use your influence or persuasiveness to change the direction of the situation positively.
Tell me how you persuaded someone to support an unpopular project or idea.
Describe a situation in which you were able to use persuasion to successfully convince someone to see/do thing your way.

Question: Tell me about a time when you used your interpersonal skills to build a network of contacts to reach goals.

Describe a time when you had to influence a number of different people groups coming from different perspectives to support you in what you wanted or needed to do. What kind of influencing techniques did you used? How were the techniques you used different from one group/person to another?
Give me an example of a time you had to convince others to conform to a policy, practice, or procedure you didn't believe in.

Tell me about a specific experience of yours that illustrates your ability to influence another person verbally. Use an example that involves _____________ (e.g., changing an attitude, selling a idea, changing a process/procedure).
Give me an example of a time when you persuaded someone to do something that the person did not, initially, want to do.
Tell me about a situation where you had to persuade someone to accept your idea or proposal.
Describe a time you were unable to sell your idea to a key person.
Describe a situation in which you were unable to use persuasion to successfully convince someone to see/do things your way.
Tell me about a time where your failure to gather sufficient information resulted in your making a decision or taking an action that you probably should not have done.
Describe a time where your patience in gathering information paid off.
Tell me about the most difficult time you have had in the last couple of years gathering the information you needed for a task or project.
Give me an example of a time where, because you didn't have enough information, you felt it was wise not to voice your opinion on something.
Tell me about a situation where, because you had a strong network, you were able to gather information that others were not able to secure.
Tell me about a time when you failed to give your team or a member of your team the information needed to do the job you asked of them.
Give me an example of a time you provided a direct report with information that helped her make a good decision.
Describe a situation where you delayed providing others with information that would have been valuable to them.
Give me an example of a time where you felt you did an outstanding job of sharing information with another person.

Give me an example of a time when you were slow to share information with your direct reports or team members and this had a negative impact on one or more of them.
Give an example of a goal you surpassed and how you achieved it.
Have you ever been a situation where you didn’t have enough work?
Please describe when you’ve gone above and beyond the call of duty.
Describe a time when you were given additional responsibilities based on your performance.
Tell me about a time when you showed initiative at your last job.
How have you taken on additional work without stepping on a colleague’s toes?
Describe a significant project idea you initiated in the last year. How did you know it was needed? Was it used? How did it work?
Give me an example of a project where you came up with the idea and managed the process start to finish.
Give me an example of a project or task that you had to accomplish without sufficient information, guidelines, or direction.
Tell me about a project or idea-not necessarily you own-that was implemented successfully primarily because of your efforts.
Describe a situation where you responded proactively.
Give me an example of something that you have done to make your job easier or more interesting.
Describe a situation in which you recognized a potential problem as an opportunity.
Give me an example of a time you went above or beyond the call of duty in order to get a job done.
Describe a time where you took the initiative to act rather than waiting to be told what to do.
Tell me about a time you reached out for additional responsabilities.
Give me some examples of you doing more than what was expected of you in your job.
Tell me about a time when you pushed yourself to do more than was necessary.
We all have periods of downtime at work. Tell me about a downtime you had, why you had it, and what you did with that time.
Give me an example of an idea you tried to sell to management that was not adopted. Why do you think it wasn't adopted? If you had it to do over again, what would you do differently?

What's your method to make your team more innovative?
What have you done differently than your predecessors? How/ Why?
What to look / probing questions: Force them to look for alternatives, bring different profiles, etc.

Question: Unfortunately, some solutions do not completely address some problems. Can you think of an interesting solution that you came up with that did not completely work? What was the situation, and what was your solution?
What to look / probing questions: Look the other way

Question: Can you think of a time when your standard approach to problem solving did not work? What did you do?
What to look / probing questions: Look the other way

What to look / probing questions: Look the other way

Question: What have you done that is out of the ordinary?
What to look / probing questions: Look the other way

Focus on actions and outcomes.

Question: Tell me about a time when you messed up with a sensitive topic / reveal a confidential information by mistake.

Give me an example of a time when you were able to keep a confidence, even when you were tempted to break it or it would have been easier to break it.
Tell me about a specific time when you had to handle a tough problem that challenged fairness or ethical issues.

Give me an example of a specific occasion in which you conformed to a policy with which you did not agree.
Tell me about a time when you gave the benefit of the doubt to someone and were glad that you did.

At times we are all faced with the situation of having to tell a customer, employee, boss, or someone else No, because we don't believe that Yes will be the right answer- even though it will be the easy answer. Tell me about a time you faced this kind of situation.
Tell me about a time when you took responsibility for mistake before anyone else even knew that you had made a mistake.

Give me an example of the time you had to present the unvarnished truth to someone, but were able to do it in a positive and helpful manner.
We have all done things that we regretted after the fact. Give me an example of a time this happened to you. If you had it to do over again, what would you do differently?
Describe an occasion when you bent one of your core values or beliefs during a bad time.
Tell me about a time where you didn't practice what you preach.
Tell me about a time when you chose not to give someone the benefit or the doubt and wished, in hindsight, you had.
Describe for me a situation when you had to build and maintain a new relationship in order to accomplish a business goal.

Building rapport with some people can be challenging. Give me an example of a time when you were able to build rapport quickly with someone in your organization, even though the situation was a difficult one.
Describe a time when you were able to "read" another person effectively and, as a result, were able to adjust your actions to meet this person's needs or values.

Tell me about a time when you had to deal with a  (rude, sarcastic, know-it-all, gossipy, negative, uncooperative, or finger-pointing) person. How did you handle the situation? Were you able to get along? How (or why not)?

What to look / probing questions: Make sure you find out who the person was they disagreed with, what the outcome was, and whether the outcome was positive-or if not, what happened to keep it from being a positive outcome.
